ticket.title: add :new_if_blank option to fields_for for nested associations
ticket.original-body:
This patch will allow you to initialize any blank associations for your models that are using nested_attributes_for.
# for one-to-one association form_for(@post) do |f| f.text_field(:title)
f.fields_for(:author, :new_if_blank => true) do |af| af.text_field(:name) end end
# for collection associations # this will create 3 blank comments form_for(@post) do |f| f.text_field(:title)
f.fields_for(:comments, :new_if_blank => 3) do |cf| cf.text_field(:name) end end
ticket.latest-body:
This patch will allow you to initialize any blank associations for your models that are using nested_attributes_for.
# for one-to-one association form_for(@post) do |f| f.text_field(:title)
f.fields_for(:author, :new_if_blank => true) do |af| af.text_field(:name) end end
# for collection associations # this will create 3 blank comments form_for(@post) do |f| f.text_field(:title)
f.fields_for(:comments, :new_if_blank => 3) do |cf| cf.text_field(:name) end end
ticket.original-body-html:
This patch will allow you to initialize any blank associations for your models that are using nested_attributes_for.

# for one-to-one association
form_for(@post) do |f|
  f.text_field(:title)

  f.fields_for(:author, :new_if_blank => true) do |af|
    af.text_field(:name)
  end
end

# for collection associations
# this will create 3 blank comments
form_for(@post) do |f|
  f.text_field(:title)

  f.fields_for(:comments, :new_if_blank => 3) do |cf|
    cf.text_field(:name)
  end
end

version.body:
This patch will allow you to initialize any blank associations for your models that are using nested_attributes_for.
# for one-to-one association form_for(@post) do |f| f.text_field(:title)
f.fields_for(:author, :new_if_blank => true) do |af| af.text_field(:name) end end
# for collection associations # this will create 3 blank comments form_for(@post) do |f| f.text_field(:title)
f.fields_for(:comments, :new_if_blank => 3) do |cf| cf.text_field(:name) end end
version.body-html:
This patch will allow you to initialize any blank associations for your models that are using nested_attributes_for.

# for one-to-one association
form_for(@post) do |f|
  f.text_field(:title)

  f.fields_for(:author, :new_if_blank => true) do |af|
    af.text_field(:name)
  end
end

# for collection associations
# this will create 3 blank comments
form_for(@post) do |f|
  f.text_field(:title)

  f.fields_for(:comments, :new_if_blank => 3) do |cf|
    cf.text_field(:name)
  end
end
version.title: add :new_if_blank option to fields_for for nested associations
add :new_if_blank option to fields_for for nested associations

version.body:
The patch looks good! Although I only had time to look at the patch atm, so disregard any notes if I didn't understand it well enough ;-)
Instead of using:
@@@ ruby (args[:new_if_blank].to_i rescue 1).times do nested_association << klass.new end @@@
I'd prefer:
@@@ ruby (args[:new_if_blank].is_a?(Numeric) ? args[:new_if_blank] : 1).times do nested_association << klass.new end @@@
As there is always the chance of masking real exceptions when using a inline rescue. Plus the fact that args[:new_if_blank] can be, for instance, 'true' which is not exceptional.
Personally I'd refactor that area somewhat like the following. But I will have a more thorough pass at this once I apply the patch anyways, so it doesn't really matter for now.
@@@ ruby def build_nested_association(association_name, times) klass = association_name.to_s.classify.constantize if @object.send(association_name).is_a?(Array) Array.new(times.is_a?(Numeric) ? times : 1) { klass.new } else klass.new end end
... if association.blank? && args.last.is_a?(Hash) && (times = args.last[:new_if_blank]) association = build_nested_association(association_name, times) end @@@
Also, as I understand it there will still be a NoMethodError raised if there's no single association build right?
I think that in this case we should not yield a new form builder at all, as is the case with an empty collection association. This was already being discussed on #2172. Thoughts?
version.body-html:
The patch looks good! Although I only had time to look at the patch atm, so disregard any notes if I didn't understand it well enough ;-)

Instead of using:


(args[:new_if_blank].to_i rescue 1).times do
   nested_association << klass.new
end

I'd prefer:


(args[:new_if_blank].is_a?(Numeric) ? args[:new_if_blank] : 1).times do
   nested_association << klass.new
end

As there is always the chance of masking real exceptions when using a inline rescue. Plus the fact that args[:new_if_blank] can be, for instance, 'true' which is not exceptional.

Personally I'd refactor that area somewhat like the following. But I will have a more thorough pass at this once I apply the patch anyways, so it doesn't really matter for now.


def build_nested_association(association_name, times)
  klass = association_name.to_s.classify.constantize
  if @object.send(association_name).is_a?(Array)
    Array.new(times.is_a?(Numeric) ? times : 1) { klass.new }
  else
    klass.new
  end
end

...
if association.blank? && args.last.is_a?(Hash) && (times = args.last[:new_if_blank])
  association = build_nested_association(association_name, times)
end

Also, as I understand it there will still be a NoMethodError raised if there's no single association build right?

I think that in this case we should not yield a new form builder at all, as is the case with an empty collection association. This was already being discussed on #2172. Thoughts?
version.title: add :new_if_blank option to fields_for for nested associations

version.body: Oh btw, normally I'd refrain from theorizing. But I wonder if it might be a good idea to have ":new => 3" as an option for a collection association as well, which would _always_ add 3 new objects.
version.body-html: Oh btw, normally I'd refrain from theorizing. But I wonder if it might be a good idea to have ":new => 3" as an option for a collection association as well, which would always add 3 new objects.
version.title: add :new_if_blank option to fields_for for nested associations

version.body: I think the refactorings are spot on. The fact that :new_is_blank can be true is not really exceptional in this case. Also `build_nested_association` is now a little easier on the eyes.
version.body-html: I think the refactorings are spot on. The fact that :new_is_blank can be true is not really exceptional in this case. Also build_nested_association is now a little easier on the eyes.
version.title: add :new_if_blank option to fields_for for nested associations

version.body: Here's an updated patch based on Eloy's suggestions for refactoring.
version.body-html: Here's an updated patch based on Eloy's suggestions for refactoring.
version.title: add :new_if_blank option to fields_for for nested associations

version.body: I'm not sure I like the idea of the option ":new => 3" for collection associations. I'd have to play around with it to get a real feel for it.
version.body-html: I'm not sure I like the idea of the option ":new => 3" for collection associations. I'd have to play around with it to get a real feel for it.
version.title: add :new_if_blank option to fields_for for nested associations

version.body: Guys, wouldn't be better to use :build_if_blank? We are building an object in such cases...
version.body-html: Guys, wouldn't be better to use :build_if_blank? We are building an object in such cases...
version.title: add :new_if_blank option to fields_for for nested associations

version.body: I was originally calling the param [create_blank](http://gist.github.com/82349, "create_blank") but I can't for the life of me remember why we renamed it. Eloy do you recall?
version.body-html: I was originally calling the param create_blank but I can't for the life of me remember why we renamed it. Eloy do you recall?
version.title: add :new_if_blank option to fields_for for nested associations

version.body-html:
@Jose

I believe the reason we went with "new" over "build" (or "create") is because Eloy wants to stay ORM agnostic. "build" is an AR convention so we went with "new". If you look at the patch it doesn't actually call build it calls new.

(hopefully Eloy will correct me if I got it wrong)
version.title: add :new_if_blank option to fields_for for nested associations

version.body:
> (hopefully Eloy will correct me if I got it wrong)
You are spot on good sir :)

(hopefully Eloy will correct me if I got it wrong)

You are spot on good sir :)

version.body:
As I mentioned to mike in irc, the only line here which concerns me is:
@@@ + if @object.send(association_name).is_a?(Array) @@@
is that a reasonable way to test this condition? I assume the is_a? test won't fetch the association?
If that still looks right to you guys, I'm happy to merge it it.
version.body-html:
As I mentioned to mike in irc, the only line here which concerns me is:

+          if @object.send(association_name).is_a?(Array)

is that a reasonable way to test this condition? I assume the is_a? test won't fetch the association?

If that still looks right to you guys, I'm happy to merge it it.
version.title: add :new_if_blank option to fields_for for nested associations

version.body: Association array determination is a problem I looked at when putting together my patch #2648. As far as I can tell the is_a? will not be intercepted by the collection proxy so it will instantiate the association. I found it hard to find a neat way around this while still keeping the view code ORM agnostic. I did consider checking for "#{association_name}_ids=" method or adding is_a? to the proxy collection but neither seem like great ideas.
version.body-html: Association array determination is a problem I looked at when putting together my patch #2648. As far as I can tell the is_a? will not be intercepted by the collection proxy so it will instantiate the association. I found it hard to find a neat way around this while still keeping the view code ORM agnostic. I did consider checking for "#{association_name}_ids=" method or adding is_a? to the proxy collection but neither seem like great ideas.
version.title: add :new_if_blank option to fields_for for nested associations

version.body:
This option is hard to understand and harder to discover. I'm worried it's making the API muddier not clearer.
When would you want :build_if_blank => false?
version.body-html:

version.title: add :new_if_blank option to fields_for for nested associations

version.body:
In fact, iirc, I only needed that once. And it was quite the edge case. So am I correct in understanding that you mean; ”default to build if there's no associated record“ ?
If so, I think you're right. I would still like to be able to disable it though. And for a collection association you might want build more than 1 record. Although in retrospect, we could default this to just one as well. At least for now.
version.body-html:
In fact, iirc, I only needed that once. And it was quite the edge case. So am I correct in understanding that you mean; ”default to build if there's no associated record“ ?

If so, I think you're right. I would still like to be able to disable it though. And for a collection association you might want build more than 1 record. Although in retrospect, we could default this to just one as well. At least for now.

version.body: This supra footwear is called a modern vintage and has been since their introduction in 2003 where they began in Europe. Every supra shoes has some type of ornament, adornment or hardware and is comprised of aged leather that is bought from around the world. These supra uk are culturally engaging and allow for the woman wearing them to be enveloped in luxury.With new cuts and styles and hand stitched shoes, these timberland boots, heels or flats will make every foot look like it stepped out of vintage Hollywood. This timberland shoes have been worn and coveted by many of the most famous females in recent history. One such coach outlet, Jennifer Aniston, wears them in public and at home.This company makes many different unique styles of bags outlet from ankle booties to sandals, pumps, moncler jackets online, platforms and wedges. One louis vuitton bag in particular is ideal for the gothic style sense; it is patent leather and laces up the front of the shaft. There are also zippers on each side, and this shoe offers a flat heel of a half inch.Another great moncler jackets sale is featured in People's Style Watch and is called a platform bootie. This ture religion jeans has a raised panel in front of the ankle as well as a heel that measures 4.5 inches. The front offers a leather bandage appearance and is considered high fashion.

version.body: 私の中で、総合評価のとっても低いアバアバクロホリスタークロ銀座店。アバクロは大好きなんですけどね。一昨日の東京駅付近での打ち合わせの後、散歩がてら久々に行ってきました。そしたらビックリ！相変わらアバクロず、踊っているだけの店員さんとかもいましたが、
